document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Anastatus mantoidae Motschulsky, the type species of Anastatus Motschulsky 1859, and Anastatus echidna (Motschulsky), the type species of Cacotropia Motschulsky 1863, with respect to taxonomy of Anastatus (Hymenoptera: Eupelmidae: Eupelminae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Anastatus mantoidae Motschulsky, the type species of Anastatus Motschulsky 1859, and Anastatus echidna (Motschulsky), the type species of Cacotropia Motschulsky 1863, with respect to taxonomy of Anastatus (Hymenoptera: Eupelmidae: Eupelminae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anastatus Motschulsky, 1859: 116
. Type species:
Anastatus mantoidae Motschulsky. Monotypy. Described
: both sexes.

Cacotropia Motschulsky, 1863: 55
. Type species:
Cacotropia echidna Motschulsky. Monotypy. Described
: female. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1988: 550
.

Antigaster Walsh and Riley, 1869: 156
. Type species:
Antigaster mirabilis Walsh and Riley. Monotypy. Described
: female. Synonymy by
Ashmead, 1896: 5
, 9.

Misocoris Rondani, 1877: 187
. Type species:
Misocoris oophagus Rondani
[=
Anastatus bifasciatus (Geoffroy)
]. Described: male. Subsequent designation by
Bouček, 1974: 260
. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1974: 260
, 262.

Solindenia Cameron, 1883: 189
. Type species:
Solindenia picticornis Cameron. Monotypy. Described
: female. Synonymy by
Swezey, 1946: 213
.

Paraguaya Girault, 1911: 395–396
. Type species:
Paraguaya pulchripennis Girault. Monotypy
and original designation. Described: female. Synonymy by
Girault, 1915: 19
.

Parooderella Girault, 1913: 88
. Type species:
Parooderella aptera Girault. Monotypy
and original designation. Described: female. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1988: 550
.

Parasolindenia Girault, 1913: 90
. Type species:
Parasolindenia hemiptera Girault. Monotypy
and original designation. Preoccupied by
Parasolindenia Brues, 1907: 48
. Described: female. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1988: 550
.

Pseudanastatus Masi, 1917: 162–163
. Type species:
Pseudanastatus crassicornis Masi. Monotypy. Described
: female. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1976: 350
.

Pseudooderella Brèthes, 1922: 127
. Type species:
Pseudooderella catamarcensis Brèthes. Monotypy. Described
: female. Synonymy by
De Santis, 1960: 111
.

Cerycium Erdős, 1946: 137
. Type species:
Cerycium pratense Erdős
[=
Anastatus bifasciatus (Geoffroy)
]. Described: male. Monotypy and original designation. Synonymy by
Erdős, 1960: 207
.

Vignalia Risbec, 1951: 272
. Type species:
Vignalia halyomorphae Risbec. Monotypy. Described
: both sexes. Synonymy by
Risbec 1955: 218
.

Paravignalia Risbec, 1951: 274
. Type species:
Paravignalia hemipterae Risbec
[=
Anastatus aliberti Risbec
]. Monotypy. Described: male. Synonymy by
Risbec, 1955: 218
.

Proanastatus De Santis, 1952: 267–268
. Type species:
Proanastatus excavatus De Santis. Monotypy
and original designation. Described: female. Synonymy by
De Santis 1980: 201
[as a subgenus].

Descampsia Risbec, 1955: 212–213
. Type species:
Descampsia dipterae Risbec. Monotypy. Described
: both sexes. Synonymy by
Gibson, 1995: 101
.

Anastatimorpha Erdős, 1957: 363
. Type species:
Anastatimorpha siderea Erdős. Monotypy
and original designation. Described: female. Synonymy by
Bouček, 1970: 81
.

Anastatus ( Cladanastatus ) Bouček, 1979: 93–96
. Type species:
Anastatus ( Cladanastatus ) umae Bouček
[=
Oodera madagascariensis Risbec
]. Described: female.
